File modification events where the modif.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 (object access/write) and Zeek file.log for file modification events and associated timestamps (`mtime`). Analyze the distribution and sequence of modification times (`mtime`). Identify files exhibiting modification times that are significantly out of sequence with file system traversal logs or appear to predate other related events (e.g., user login, process execution) using time series analysis or outlier detection on timestamps.

File creation or modification timestamps.Data: Windows Event ID 4663, Windows Event ID 4688, Zeek file.log
File creation or modification timestamps.Action: Collect Windows Event ID 4663 (file modify) and Zeek file.log (`mtime`, `ctime`) along with Windows Event ID 4688 (process creation). Correlate file modification/creation events with the process that performed the action (if available in logs). Calculate the difference between the file's modification/creation timestamp and the timestamp of the process that created/modified it. Use descriptive statistics (mean, median, variance) and outlier detection (e.g., Z-score, IQR) to identify files where this time difference is unusually large (e.g., file timestamp is much older than the creating process). Investigate files with significant discrepancies.
